content:
Here is an adjusted layout for the Annotation Tool screen, with a larger main content area for the document preview:

1. Top Navigation Bar: Contains the logo, page title, user menu, and other global navigation elements.
2. Left Sidebar: Contains the document outline and label hierarchy, as well as any other tools or controls related to navigation or annotation.
3. Main Content Area: Contains the document being annotated, with the label toolbar displayed either above or below it. The main content area takes up a larger portion of the screen to allow for a larger preview of the document.
4. Right Sidebar: Contains the label suggestion feature, label conflict resolution tool, and label history, as well as any other tools or controls related to annotation.
5. Bottom Navigation Bar: Contains the pagination controls, progress bar, zoom controls, and any other tools or controls related to navigation or annotation.

This layout allows users to easily access all the necessary tools and controls while annotating the document, and provides a clear separation between the different areas of the screen. The larger main content area allows for a better preview of the document, which can be particularly helpful for long documents with many pages.
